meanings.definition: Past tense of forbear: refrained from doing something
meanings.sent1: She forbore from eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: He forbore to interrupt the speaker during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy forbore from chewing on the new shoes.
meanings.sent4: The artist forbore adding any more colors to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The student forbore from checking their phone during the exam.

meanings.definition: Past participle of forbear: refrained from doing something
meanings.sent1: They had forbore from making any noise during the movie.
meanings.sent2: The team forbore to celebrate until the final whistle blew.
meanings.sent3: The chef forbore from adding extra salt to the dish.
meanings.sent4: The tree forbore from shedding its leaves until the spring.
meanings.sent5: The driver forbore from honking despite the traffic jam.
